required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of MK-1439A and ATRIPLA™ in Treatment-Naive Human Immunodeficiency Virus Type 1 (HIV-1)-Infected Participants (MK-1439A-021)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Active Comparator-Controlled Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of MK-1439A Once-Daily Versus ATRIPLA™ Once-Daily in Treatment-Naïve HIV-1 Infected Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the antiretroviral activity of MK-1439A, a single-tablet, once-daily (q.d.) fixed-dose combination (FDC) containing doravirine (MK-1439) 100 mg + lamivudine 300 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, with ATRIPLA™, a single-tablet FDC containing efavirenz 600 mg + emtricitabine 200 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, in treatment-naive participants infected with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). The primary hypothesis is that MK-1439A q.d. is non-inferior to ATRIPLA™ q.d. as assessed by the proportion of participants with HIV-1 ribonucleic acid (RNA) <50 copies/mL (by the Abbott RealTime HIV-1 Assay) at Week 48.

detailed_description.textblock: This study has a total duration of 96 weeks. The present results are based on the first 48 weeks of this ongoing study.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HIV-1 Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) <50 Copies/mL at Week 48
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants in each arm with HIV-1 RNA levels <50 copies/mL at Week 48 was determined. Plasma HIV-1 RNA levels were quantified with the Abbott RealTime HIV-1 Assay. Data were handled according to the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) "snapshot" approach in which all missing data are considered treatment failures, regardless of the reason.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Tier-1 Neuropsychiatric Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants in each arm experiencing ≥1 pre-specified Tier-1 neuropsychiatric AEs was determined. The list of Tier-1 neuropsychiatric AE categories included "dizziness", "sleep disorders and disturbances", and "altered sensorium" (including disturbance in attention).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HIV-1 RNA <50 Copies/mL at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants in each arm with HIV-1 RNA levels <50 copies/mL at Week 96 will be determined. Plasma HIV-1 RNA levels will be quantified with the Abbott RealTime HIV-1 Assay. The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) "snapshot" approach (i.e., all missing data handled as treatment failures, regardless of the reason) will be used for efficacy analyses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HIV-1 RNA <40 Copies/mL at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants in each arm with HIV-1 RNA levels <40 copies/mL (including target detected and target not detected) at Week 48 was determined. Plasma HIV RNA levels were quantified with the Abbott RealTime HIV-1 Assay. Data were handled according to the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) "snapshot" approach in which all missing data are considered treatment failures, regardless of the reason.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HIV-1 RNA <40 Copies/mL at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants in each arm with HIV-1 RNA levels <40 copies/mL (including target detected and target not detected) at Week 96 will be determined. Plasma HIV-1 RNA levels will be quantified with the Abbott RealTime HIV-1 Assay. The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) "snapshot" approach (i.e., all missing data handled as treatment failures, regardless of the reason) will be used for efficacy analyses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in CD4 Cell Counts at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in CD4 cell counts at Week 48 was assessed using the Observed Failure (OF) approach. With the OF approach, baseline values were carried forward for participants who discontinued prior to Week 48 due to lack of efficacy. Cell counts at Baseline and Week 48 were measured and expressed as cells/mm^3, and percent change was then calculated as [(Baseline counts - Week 48 counts)*100]. CD4 cell counts were quantified by a central laboratory using a commercially available assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in CD4 Cell Counts at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in CD4 cell counts at Week 96 will be assessed using the Observed Failure (OF) approach. With the OF approach, baseline values will be carried forward for participants who discontinued prior to Week 96 due to lack of efficacy. Cell counts at Baseline and Week 96 will be measured and expressed as cells/mm^3, and percent change will then be calculated as [(Baseline counts - Week 96 counts)*100]. CD4 cell counts will be quantified by a central laboratory using a commercially available assay.
An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Discontinuing From Study Medication Due to an AE(s)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Tier-2 Neuropsychiatric AEs
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants in each arm experiencing ≥1 pre-specified Tier-2 neuropsychiatric AEs was determined. The list of Tier-2 neuropsychiatric AE categories included "depression and suicide/self-injury" and "psychosis and psychotic disorders".

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting LDL-C at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: The mean percent change from baseline in fasting (fast duration of ≥8 hours) LDL-C levels at Week 48 was determined for each arm. The Last Observation Carry Forward (LOCF) approach was applied to missing data and data collected after a participant initiated lipid-modifying therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Non-HDL-C at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: The mean percent change from baseline in fasting (fast duration of ≥8 hours) non-HDL-C levels at Week 48 was determined for each arm. The LOCF approach was applied to missing data and data collected after a participant initiated lipid-modifying therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Cholesterol at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: The mean percent change from baseline in fasting (fast duration of ≥8 hours) cholesterol levels at Week 48 was determined for each arm. The LOCF approach was applied to missing data and data collected after a participant initiated lipid-modifying therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Triglycerides at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: The mean percent change from baseline in fasting (fast duration of ≥8 hours) triglycerides levels at Week 48 was determined for each arm. The LOCF approach was applied to missing data and data collected after a participant initiated lipid-modifying therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting HDL-C at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: The mean percent change from baseline in fasting (fast duration of ≥8 hours) HDL-C levels at Week 48 was determined for each arm. The LOCF approach was applied to missing data and data collected after a participant initiated lipid-modifying therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HIV-1 RNA Below the Limit of Quantification (BLoQ) at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants in each arm with HIV-1 RNA levels BLoQ of 40 copies/mL and target not detected at Week 48 was determined. Plasma HIV RNA levels were quantified with the Abbott RealTime HIV-1 Assay. Data were handled as observed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HIV-1 RNA BLoQ at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants in each arm with HIV-1 RNA levels BLoQ of 40 copies/mL and target not detected at Week 96 will be determined. Plasma HIV RNA levels will be quantified with the Abbott RealTime HIV-1 Assay. Data will be handled as observed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of Doravirine at Week 48
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 hours post-dose and 2 hours post-dose on Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were collected for analysis of doravirine concentration at Week 48. A total of 2 samples were collected: 1 prior to dosing and 1 collected between 0.5 and 2 hours post-dose.

arm_group.description: Treatment-naive HIV-infected participants will receive MK-1439A, a single-tablet FDC containing doravirine 100 mg + lamivudine 300 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, q.d. by mouth for 96 weeks. Participants will also take 1 placebo tablet matched to ATRIPLA™ q.d. by mouth for 96 weeks in order to maintain blinding.

Treatment-naive HIV-infected participants will receive ATRIPLA™, a single-tablet FDC containing efavirenz 600 mg + emtricitabine 200 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg (equivalent to 245 mg tenofovir disoproxil), q.d. by mouth for 96 weeks. Participants will also take 1 placebo tablet matched to MK-1439A q.d. by mouth for 96 weeks in order to maintain blinding.

intervention.description: One MK-1439A tablet taken q.d. by mouth.
One ATRIPLA™ tablet taken q.d. by mouth
Placebo tablets matched to ATRIPLA® or MK-1439A.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Is HIV-1 positive as determined by a positive result on an enzyme-immunoassay, has screening plasma HIV-1 RNA (determined by the central laboratory) ≥1000 copies/mL within 45 days prior to the treatment phase of this study, and has HIV treatment indicated based on physician assessment
- Has never received antiretroviral therapy (ART)
- Is highly unlikely to either become pregnant or impregnate a partner
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has a history or current evidence of any condition, therapy, laboratory abnormality, or other circumstance that might confound results of the study
- Is a user of recreational or illicit drugs or has a recent history of alcohol/drug abuse
- Has been treated for a viral infection other than HIV-1 (e.g., hepatitis B) with an agent that is active against HIV-1
- Has participated in a study with an investigational drug/device within 30 days prior to Screening
- Has used systemic immunosuppressive therapy or immune modulators within 30 days prior to treatment in this study or is anticipated to need them during the course of the study
- Has a current (active) diagnosis of acute hepatitis due to any cause (note: participants with chronic hepatitis B and C may enter the study as long as they fulfill all entry criteria, have stable liver function tests, and have no significant impairment of hepatic synthetic function)
- Is a female who is pregnant, breastfeeding, or expecting to conceive
- Is a female and is expecting to donate eggs or is male and is expecting to donate sperm (investigators will provide appropriate guidance regarding egg and/or sperm donation after completion of the study treatment regimen)
- Has evidence of decompensated liver disease manifested by the presence of or a history of ascites, esophageal or gastric variceal bleeding, hepatic encephalopathy or other signs or symptoms of advanced liver diseases, or has liver cirrhosis and a Child-Pugh Class C score or Pugh-Turcotte (CPT) score > 9

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Efavirenz, Emtricitabine, Tenofovir Disoproxil Fumarate Drug Combination

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Treatment-naïve participants with human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1) infection have been recruited at 126 study sites worldwide. The present results are based on the first 48 weeks of this ongoing 96-week study.

group.title: MK-1439A
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took MK-1439A, a single-tablet fixed dose combination (FDC) containing doravirine 100 mg + lamivudine 300 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, once daily (q.d.) by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take MK-1439A for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to ATRIPLA™ q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

group.title: ATRIPLA™
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took ATRIPLA™, a single-tablet FDC containing efavirenz 600 mg + emtricitabine 200 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg (equivalent to 245 mg tenofovir disoproxil), q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take ATRIPLA for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to MK-1439A q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

baseline.population: The Baseline Analysis Population consists of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study drug.

group.title: MK-1439A
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took MK-1439A, a single-tablet FDC containing doravirine 100 mg + lamivudine 300 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take MK-1439A for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to ATRIPLA™ q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

group.title: ATRIPLA™
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took ATRIPLA™, a single-tablet FDC containing efavirenz 600 mg + emtricitabine 200 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg (equivalent to 245 mg tenofovir disoproxil), q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take ATRIPLA for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to MK-1439A q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race (NIH/OMB)

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Baseline cluster of differentiation 4 (CD4) cell counts
Baseline fasting low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C)
measure.description: Participants fasted for ≥8 hours prior to LDL-C measurement on Day 1.
measure.population: All randomized participants with baseline data available.

measure.description: Participants fasted for ≥8 hours prior to non-HDL-C measurement on Day 1.
measure.population: All randomized participants with baseline data available.

measure.description: Participants fasted for ≥8 hours prior to cholesterol measurement on Day 1.
measure.population: All randomized participants with baseline data available.

measure.description: Participants fasted for ≥8 hour prior to triglycerides measurement on Day 1.
measure.population: All randomized participants with baseline data available.

measure.title: Baseline fasting high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C)
measure.description: Participants fasted for ≥8 hours prior to HDL-C measurement on Day 1.
measure.population: All randomized participants with baseline data available.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With HIV-1 Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) <50 Copies/mL at Week 48
outcome.description: The percentage of participants in each arm with HIV-1 RNA levels <50 copies/mL at Week 48 was determined. Plasma HIV-1 RNA levels were quantified with the Abbott RealTime HIV-1 Assay. Data were handled according to the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) "snapshot" approach in which all missing data are considered treatment failures, regardless of the reason.
outcome.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had baseline HIV-1 RNA data available.

group.title: MK-1439A
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took MK-1439A, a single-tablet FDC containing doravirine 100 mg + lamivudine 300 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take MK-1439A for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to ATRIPLA™ q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

group.title: ATRIPLA™
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took ATRIPLA™, a single-tablet FDC containing efavirenz 600 mg + emtricitabine 200 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg (equivalent to 245 mg tenofovir disoproxil), q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take ATRIPLA for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to MK-1439A q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With HIV-1 Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) <50 Copies/mL at Week 48
measure.description: The percentage of participants in each arm with HIV-1 RNA levels <50 copies/mL at Week 48 was determined. Plasma HIV-1 RNA levels were quantified with the Abbott RealTime HIV-1 Assay. Data were handled according to the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) "snapshot" approach in which all missing data are considered treatment failures, regardless of the reason.
measure.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had baseline HIV-1 RNA data available.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was declared if the lower bound of the 95% CI of the mean treatment difference was greater than -10.
analysis.estimate_desc: The 95% CIs for difference in percentages were calculated using stratum-adjusted Mantel-Haenszel method for each stratum (HIV-1 RNA ≤100,000 or >100,000 copies/mL).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Tier-1 Neuropsychiatric Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: The percentage of participants in each arm experiencing ≥1 pre-specified Tier-1 neuropsychiatric AEs was determined. The list of Tier-1 neuropsychiatric AE categories included "dizziness", "sleep disorders and disturbances", and "altered sensorium" (including disturbance in attention).
outcome.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication.

group.title: MK-1439A
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took MK-1439A, a single-tablet FDC containing doravirine 100 mg + lamivudine 300 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take MK-1439A for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to ATRIPLA™ q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

group.title: ATRIPLA™
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took ATRIPLA™, a single-tablet FDC containing efavirenz 600 mg + emtricitabine 200 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg (equivalent to 245 mg tenofovir disoproxil), q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take ATRIPLA for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to MK-1439A q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Tier-1 Neuropsychiatric Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: The percentage of participants in each arm experiencing ≥1 pre-specified Tier-1 neuropsychiatric AEs was determined. The list of Tier-1 neuropsychiatric AE categories included "dizziness", "sleep disorders and disturbances", and "altered sensorium" (including disturbance in attention).
measure.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Superiority was declared when the 1-sided p-value comparing treatment difference was <0.02497.
analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CIs were calculated using the Miettinen and Nurminen method.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Superiority was declared when the 1-sided p-value comparing treatment difference was <0.02497.
analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CIs were calculated using the Miettinen and Nurminen method.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Superiority was declared when the 1-sided p-value comparing treatment difference was <0.02497.
analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CIs were calculated using the Miettinen and Nurminen method.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With HIV-1 RNA <50 Copies/mL at Week 96
outcome.description: The percentage of participants in each arm with HIV-1 RNA levels <50 copies/mL at Week 96 will be determined. Plasma HIV-1 RNA levels will be quantified with the Abbott RealTime HIV-1 Assay. The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) "snapshot" approach (i.e., all missing data handled as treatment failures, regardless of the reason) will be used for efficacy analyses.
outcome.population: The analysis population will consist of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had baseline HIV-1 RNA data available. The current results are based on the first 48 weeks of the study; Week 96 results will be provided in a future report.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in CD4 Cell Counts at Week 48
outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in CD4 cell counts at Week 48 was assessed using the Observed Failure (OF) approach. With the OF approach, baseline values were carried forward for participants who discontinued prior to Week 48 due to lack of efficacy. Cell counts at Baseline and Week 48 were measured and expressed as cells/mm^3, and percent change was then calculated as [(Baseline counts - Week 48 counts)*100]. CD4 cell counts were quantified by a central laboratory using a commercially available assay.
outcome.population: The analysis population consisted of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had baseline and Week 48 CD4 data available.

group.title: MK-1439A
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took MK-1439A, a single-tablet FDC containing doravirine 100 mg + lamivudine 300 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take MK-1439A for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to MK-1439A q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in CD4 Cell Counts at Week 48
measure.description: The mean change from baseline in CD4 cell counts at Week 48 was assessed using the Observed Failure (OF) approach. With the OF approach, baseline values were carried forward for participants who discontinued prior to Week 48 due to lack of efficacy. Cell counts at Baseline and Week 48 were measured and expressed as cells/mm^3, and percent change was then calculated as [(Baseline counts - Week 48 counts)*100]. CD4 cell counts were quantified by a central laboratory using a commercially available assay.
measure.population: The analysis population consisted of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had baseline and Week 48 CD4 data available.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Superiority was declared when group difference (MK-1439A-ATRIPLA®) was a positive value.
analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CIs were calculated based on t-distribution.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in CD4 Cell Counts at Week 96
outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in CD4 cell counts at Week 96 will be assessed using the Observed Failure (OF) approach. With the OF approach, baseline values will be carried forward for participants who discontinued prior to Week 96 due to lack of efficacy. Cell counts at Baseline and Week 96 will be measured and expressed as cells/mm^3, and percent change will then be calculated as [(Baseline counts - Week 96 counts)*100]. CD4 cell counts will be quantified by a central laboratory using a commercially available assay.
outcome.population: The analysis population will consist of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had baseline CD4 data available. The current results are based on the first 48 weeks of the study; Week 96 results will be provided in a future report.

group.title: MK-1439A
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took MK-1439A, a single-tablet FDC containing doravirine 100 mg + lamivudine 300 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take MK-1439A for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to ATRIPLA™ q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

group.title: ATRIPLA™
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took ATRIPLA™, a single-tablet FDC containing efavirenz 600 mg + emtricitabine 200 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg (equivalent to 245 mg tenofovir disoproxil), q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take ATRIPLA for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to MK-1439A q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in CD4 Cell Counts at Week 96
measure.description: The mean change from baseline in CD4 cell counts at Week 96 will be assessed using the Observed Failure (OF) approach. With the OF approach, baseline values will be carried forward for participants who discontinued prior to Week 96 due to lack of efficacy. Cell counts at Baseline and Week 96 will be measured and expressed as cells/mm^3, and percent change will then be calculated as [(Baseline counts - Week 96 counts)*100]. CD4 cell counts will be quantified by a central laboratory using a commercially available assay.
measure.population: The analysis population will consist of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had baseline CD4 data available. The current results are based on the first 48 weeks of the study; Week 96 results will be provided in a future report.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Experiencing ≥1 AE
outcome.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment.
outcome.population: The analysis population consisted of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication.

group.title: MK-1439A

Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to ATRIPLA™ q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Experiencing ≥1 AE
measure.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment.
measure.population: The analysis population consisted of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Difference in percentage of participants with ≥1 AE(s)
analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CIs were calculated with the Miettinen & Nurminen method.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Discontinuing From Study Medication Due to an AE(s)
measure.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Tier-2 Neuropsychiatric AEs
outcome.description: The percentage of participants in each arm experiencing ≥1 pre-specified Tier-2 neuropsychiatric AEs was determined. The list of Tier-2 neuropsychiatric AE categories included "depression and suicide/self-injury" and "psychosis and psychotic disorders".
outcome.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication.

group.title: MK-1439A
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took MK-1439A, a single-tablet FDC containing doravirine 100 mg + lamivudine 300 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take MK-1439A for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to ATRIPLA™ q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

group.title: ATRIPLA™
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took ATRIPLA™, a single-tablet FDC containing efavirenz 600 mg + emtricitabine 200 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg (equivalent to 245 mg tenofovir disoproxil), q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take ATRIPLA for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to MK-1439A q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Tier-2 Neuropsychiatric AEs
measure.description: The percentage of participants in each arm experiencing ≥1 pre-specified Tier-2 neuropsychiatric AEs was determined. The list of Tier-2 neuropsychiatric AE categories included "depression and suicide/self-injury" and "psychosis and psychotic disorders".
measure.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Superiority was declared when the 1-sided p-value comparing treatment difference was <0.02497.
analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CIs were calculated using the Miettinen and Nurminen method.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Superiority was declared when the 1-sided p-value comparing treatment difference was <0.02497.
analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CIs were calculated using the Miettinen and Nurminen method.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Fasting LDL-C at Week 48
outcome.description: The mean percent change from baseline in fasting (fast duration of ≥8 hours) LDL-C levels at Week 48 was determined for each arm. The Last Observation Carry Forward (LOCF) approach was applied to missing data and data collected after a participant initiated lipid-modifying therapy.
outcome.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized participants who had baseline LDL-C data available as well as ≥1 LDL-C measurement after initiating study treatment.

group.title: MK-1439A
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took MK-1439A, a single-tablet FDC containing doravirine 100 mg + lamivudine 300 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take MK-1439A for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to ATRIPLA™ q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

group.title: ATRIPLA™
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took ATRIPLA™, a single-tablet FDC containing efavirenz 600 mg + emtricitabine 200 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg (equivalent to 245 mg tenofovir disoproxil), q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take ATRIPLA for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to MK-1439A q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Fasting LDL-C at Week 48
measure.description: The mean percent change from baseline in fasting (fast duration of ≥8 hours) LDL-C levels at Week 48 was determined for each arm. The Last Observation Carry Forward (LOCF) approach was applied to missing data and data collected after a participant initiated lipid-modifying therapy.
measure.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized participants who had baseline LDL-C data available as well as ≥1 LDL-C measurement after initiating study treatment.

analysis.estimate_desc: 95% CIs and 2-sided p-values for treatment difference were calculated from an ANCOVA model with terms for baseline lipid level and treatment.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With HIV-1 RNA Below the Limit of Quantification (BLoQ) at Week 48
outcome.description: The percentage of participants in each arm with HIV-1 RNA levels BLoQ of 40 copies/mL and target not detected at Week 48 was determined. Plasma HIV RNA levels were quantified with the Abbott RealTime HIV-1 Assay. Data were handled as observed.
outcome.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized participants who received ≥1 dose of study medication and had baseline HIV-1 RNA data available.

group.title: MK-1439A
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took MK-1439A, a single-tablet FDC containing doravirine 100 mg + lamivudine 300 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take MK-1439A for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to ATRIPLA™ q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

outcome.title: Plasma Concentration of Doravirine at Week 48
outcome.description: Plasma samples were collected for analysis of doravirine concentration at Week 48. A total of 2 samples were collected: 1 prior to dosing and 1 collected between 0.5 and 2 hours post-dose.
outcome.time_frame: 0 hours post-dose and 2 hours post-dose on Week 48
outcome.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized participants in the MK-1439A arm who received ≥1 dose of study drug and had doravirine concentration data available.

group.title: MK-1439A
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took MK-1439A, a single-tablet FDC containing doravirine 100 mg + lamivudine 300 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take MK-1439A for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). Participants also took 1 placebo tablet matched to ATRIPLA™ q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take placebo for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks) in order to maintain blinding.

measure.title: Plasma Concentration of Doravirine at Week 48
measure.description: Plasma samples were collected for analysis of doravirine concentration at Week 48. A total of 2 samples were collected: 1 prior to dosing and 1 collected between 0.5 and 2 hours post-dose.
measure.population: The analysis population consists of all randomized participants in the MK-1439A arm who received ≥1 dose of study drug and had doravirine concentration data available.

reported_events.desc: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment. All participants who received ≥1 dose of study drug are included.

group.title: MK-1439A (DOR+LAM+TEN)
group.description: Treatment-naive participants with HIV-1 infection took MK-1439A, a single-tablet FDC containing doravirine 100 mg + lamivudine 300 mg + tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg, q.d. by mouth for 48 weeks (and will take MK-1439A for an additional 48 weeks for a total of 96 weeks). category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Squamous cell carcinoma of the tongue

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts or presentations regarding this trial 45 days prior to submission for publication/presentation.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
